note: Left. Queer. Trans Woman. Lover of science fact/fiction and frogs I studied environmental science, and have since worked as a barista, science writer, substitute teacher, recreation aide, and job coach. Favorite things: cycling, reading while listening to classical/jazz/lofi, and hanging out with my partner, friends, and fish I’m new here. note: #AltText in profile pic: Image of a girl with dark hair pulled up in a bun, in a ballet studio. (barre in the background). White and black face paint to look dead, holding a sign with fake blood spatter. The sign reads: "I was always late. I wouldn't stop talking in class. I tried to force my turnout at my feet. I didn't apply my corrections. I always forgot the combination. I didn't point my toes. I couldn't be a good ballet student to save my life." The last line is large to stand out.

note:
Through the echoes of an acoustic
guitar and vocal expressions, Dora Bleu
explores intimacy as the place where the
imperializing war state replenishes itself.
With vocals that erupt traumas composed
by narrative time, uneven compositions
filled with stark silences and bent notes,
her songs ignore genres to exhume
vulnerable and dreamlike states.

Naturalist, family man, carpenter, amateur photographer, acitivist, non practising artist. Born when CO2 was 313 ppm.  Lekwungen Territory, Vancouver Island, Canada.
Banner: Eden Grove near Fairy Creek, Vancouver Island, B.C. Canada.
Curious and interested in science and politics. Loving facts and informed opinions. Enjoying photography and good food.

fields.name: Twitter
fields.value: Not anymore.

note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

fields.value: "Be kind to everyone you meet, for they are fighting a great battle.”
